ai.summary: Cairnhill Woods is a short, easy woodland hike in the UK, about 1.1 km in length. It suits families and casual walkers seeking a quiet nature stroll through mixed woodland with gentle terrain.
ai.terrain_summary: The trail is flat to gently undulating with a surface that may be compact gravel, packed earth, or mud depending on recent weather. Expect tree roots and occasional damp patches; conditions are generally comfortable but can be slippery when wet.
ai.safety_notes: Plan for changing weather; wear sturdy footwear and bring a waterproof layer; stay on marked paths and watch for uneven ground and roots; allow extra time in winter or after rain; carry water, a small snack, a phone with emergency numbers, and a basic first aid kit; check for ticks in wooded areas and be mindful of local wildlife; let someone know your plan and return time.
recommended_gear: Sturdy waterproof walking shoes or boots
Map or offline navigation on your phone
Fully charged phone and portable charger
Sunscreen and a hat for sunny days
Extra warm layer for cooler days
ai.best_seasons: All year, with best conditions in spring through autumn. Winter visits are possible but expect mud, shorter daylight, and colder temperatures; adjust gear accordingly.
